S.FORM: thiklɛ jari cogu rətchə.
S.TRANSL: A man eloped with a married woman.

S.FORM: jari coguaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: When he eloped —

S.FORM: abhedaŋba kisim jari cogu phɛllɛ, pəhila yaˀ raːktɛsi.
S.TRANSL: how he eloped is, first the two of them paddy-danced.

S.FORM: yaˀ raːktɛsiaŋ khunchi wayɛsi.
S.TRANSL: They paddy-danced and they were together.

S.FORM: yaˀ mɛraːktɛ khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: They paddy-danced, and

S.FORM: khunchi aphna khunchi niŋwa tɔŋɛaŋ kɔ khanhaˀ
S.TRANSL: they got along —

S.FORM: niŋwa mɛdɔŋɛaŋ — niŋwa tɔŋɛaŋ khunɛ jari cogu teˀru.
S.TRANSL: they got on, and he took her away.

S.FORM: cogu teˀruaŋ kɔ pesiaŋ khunchi himmu yuŋɛsi'llɛ khunchi himmu yuŋɛsi.
S.TRANSL: They went and stayed at his house — they stayed at his house.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ yammu tumb'ɛllɛ kɔ kuhimdaŋma hɔksu.
S.TRANSL: Then the first husband looked for his wife.

S.FORM: khɔmbha "atti pe kɔ?" pha hɔksu'llɛ ni khanhaˀ hanhaˀ hanhaˀnu kunn'yanu kullamsanu khunchi sosorik mɛwayɛ
S.TRANSL: "Where did she go?" — he looked for her, they were all together — who all — his aunts, his nephews, etc.

S.FORM: kuŋg'wa mɛwayɛ phɛaŋ kɔ sen mɛdosusi'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: His maternal uncles were there, when they asked them,

S.FORM: "khunchi ɛmbhɔ khɔllɛ teˀru ro! phəlana jari cogu teˀru."
S.TRANSL: "Those two — so-and-so took her away! So and so eloped with her and took her away!"

S.FORM: "e! teˀru" pha
S.TRANSL: "Oh! He took her!"

S.FORM: poksɛ. poksɛ'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: That was the situation.

S.FORM: yok mɛdhɔkturɔ mɛdeˀru yok mɛdhɔkturɔ mɛdeˀru'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: They went on investigating,

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ mɛnisu.
S.TRANSL: and they found out.

S.FORM: khɔtmu mɛdeˀru phɛaŋ mɛnisuaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: When they found out that she had been taken away,

S.FORM: mɛnisuaŋ kɔ yammu "ləu! teˀru kɔrɔ alla khunɛ hɔŋma
S.TRANSL: "Well, if he took her we have to look for her.

S.FORM: atti pesiaŋ mɛdeˀrui? atti pesiaŋ — yo mɛdeˀrui? tho mɛdeˀrui? phɛaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: Where did they go? Where did they take her? Did they take her down? Did they take her up?" they said,

S.FORM: mɛhɔksurɔ mɛdeˀru'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: and they went on looking, and

S.FORM: na mɛdeˀru rətchə. na mɛdeˀruaŋ hɔtna
S.TRANSL: it turned out they had taken her across over there. They had taken her

S.FORM: himna mɛdziksuaŋ yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: and hidden her in a house over there.

S.FORM: mɛdziksuaŋ yuŋɛ'llɛ kɔ — hatmu thik kɔ — yok kɛdhɔkpa thik wayɛ.
S.TRANSL: They had hidden her, but there there was one — there was a scout.

S.FORM: ha yok kɛdhɔkp'ɛllɛ kɔ yok thɔktu rətchə.
S.TRANSL: That scout had tracked them down.

S.FORM: khɔmbha yok thɔktuaŋ kɔ nisuaŋ kɔ ɛtmu yuŋ pha khunɛ nisu'llɛ kɔ "ləu!
S.TRANSL: He tracked them down, and when he had found out where they were, [the others said,] "Well,

S.FORM: lɛndik pekm'ɛllɛ kɔ amni.
S.TRANSL: if we go by day, they'll see us.

S.FORM: alla sɛndik ni pekma poŋ khɔn kɔ.
S.TRANSL: So now we must go by night.

S.FORM: sɛndik pekma tɛmma poŋ" phɛaŋ khunchi cumluŋ mɛdzogɛ.
S.TRANSL: We must go by night and catch them," they decided in council.

S.FORM: cumluŋ mɛdzogɛaŋ kɔ "alla tɛmma sɛndik khɔmbhɛllɛ sɛndik haːt paŋma hatmu?
S.TRANSL: "Who should we send there at night to catch him?

S.FORM: "mɔna haːt ani mɔna yuŋ?" phɛllɛ — "ann'ya thik yuŋ" lɔˀrɛ yammu keʈa'llɛ.
S.TRANSL: Do we have anyone there?" — "My aunt lives there," said the boy (?i.e. the husband).

S.FORM: "ləu! kɛnn'ya yuŋ kɔrɔ kɛnn'ya s'waʔ pegɛaŋ khɛnɛ mɛttɛ.
S.TRANSL: "Well, if your aunt lives there, you go secretly to your aunt and tell her.

S.FORM: kɛnn'ya pegɛaŋ mɛttɛaŋ kɔ kɛnn'yarɛ kɛmɛt lo —
S.TRANSL: If you go to your aunt, she'll tell you —

S.FORM: atti mɛimmi talthaŋ mɛimmi bhuĩ tala mɛimmi the'tmu mɛimmi
S.TRANSL: where they are sleeping — if they are sleeping upstairs or downstairs, or wherever they are sleeping.

S.FORM: atti mɛimba tɛnnɛtmu khɛnɛ yok thɔktɛaŋ yammu anigɛ amɛttɛ,"
S.TRANSL: Once you've traced out the place where they are sleeping, you tell us,"

S.FORM: phɛaŋ kɔ khan — khunɛ mɛbaŋsu mɛdesu keʈa. keʈan peaŋ kɔ keʈan ?? pe.
S.TRANSL: they said, and they sent him off, the boy. The boy went

S.FORM: kunn'ya sen tosu'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: and asked his aunt,

S.FORM: kunn'ya sen tosu'llɛ kɔ "na!" kunn'yarɛ mɛttu,
S.TRANSL: he asked her and she said "Over there!

S.FORM: "thaŋ talthaŋ mɛipsɛaŋ nɛ jari kɛdzokpa mɔnan kɔ" phɛaŋ kɔ mɛttu kunn'ya'llɛ.
S.TRANSL: They're sleeping on the upper storey, the adulterers," said his aunt.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ khunɛ phɛrɛaŋ ɛtna kudzumhaˀ kumbasi kumbhusi kun'saˀsi kumbhɔŋasi jəmmə mɛttusi.
S.TRANSL: Then he came back and told his friends, his brothers, his father's people, his paternal uncles — he told them all.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ "ləu! khɔmbhɔgɔrɔ pegi ləu! alla.
S.TRANSL: "OK! In that case, let's go!

S.FORM: allo pekmaŋ ʈhikkə yo kɛtma bela'llɛ khunɛ anninɛmba hisablɛ pegigɛaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: "Now we'll go and just when we arrive down below — we'll go in a way that we won't be seen and

S.FORM: atti — anninɛmba hisablɛ pegigɛaŋ kɔ khɛnɛ kɛnn'yarɛ kuhimmu khɛnɛ rɔt ənikhera pegɛaŋ khɛnɛ ciŋsiŋŋɛ!
S.TRANSL: you — you only — go to your aunt's house and hide.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ akkhot mak lɔˀ bekɛllɛ bela tɛmsumaŋ han tɛmsumaŋ kheksum," phɛaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: Then later, when it gets dark, let's catch him and tie him up."

S.FORM: khunchi cumluŋ khatmu khunchi mɛdzogɛ.
S.TRANSL: They met and that is what they decided.

S.FORM: mɛdzogɛaŋ — ɛmbha cumluŋ mɛdzogɛaŋ kɔ na mɛbe kɔrɔ
S.TRANSL: They held a council and went off,

S.FORM: nam th'yɛ belarɔ mɛgɛrɛ khunchi himmu kɔ.
S.TRANSL: and they arrived at the couple's house at sunset.

S.FORM: nam th'yɛ belarɔ mɛgɛrɛaŋ ni
S.TRANSL: They arrived at sunset,

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khunchi cəĩ kɔ ɛtna napmi him thikɛtmu mɛyuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: and they stayed in someone's house.

S.FORM: "atti kɛbekpaaniŋ kɔ?" mɛmɛttusi'llɛ "anigɛ kɔ yo kɛbekpaadigɛ ni,"
S.TRANSL: When people asked them, "Where are you all going?" — "We're heading down there,"

S.FORM: mɛmɛttusiaŋ iŋ mɛlɛktusi.
S.TRANSL: they lied to them.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ khunɛ kunn'yarɛ kuhimmu ciŋsiŋŋaŋ yuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: The boy was hiding in his aunt's house.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ ciŋsiŋŋaŋ ni akkho khunɛ kɔ kunn'yarɛ jəmmə mɛttu ɛtmu ɛtmu mɛipsɛaŋ nɛ bhənda
S.TRANSL: [[He hid and later his aunt told him all, where they (the couple) were sleeping —

S.FORM: asennaŋ mɛttuaŋ əi! yammu akkhottaŋ mɛttuaŋ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: she had already told him before — she told him again.]]

S.FORM: yammu mɛdɔŋsiŋŋaŋ kɔ yammu kha mɔnan sɛndik mɛbeaŋ mɛdɛmsu.
S.TRANSL: They got together and they went by night and caught the man.

S.FORM: mɛdɛmsu'llɛ lisi ŋasi mɛbhuŋsiŋŋaŋ mɛdɛmsu. mɛdɛmsuaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: Four or five of them got together and held him.

S.FORM: i mɛgheksu. i mɛgheksu'llɛ kɔ khatmu i mɛgheksuaŋ kɔ — i mɛgheksu mɛnɛssu'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: They tied him up. When they tied him up — when they had him tied up —

S.FORM: yammu hahaːtlɛ the poksɛ attiattiaŋ mɛd'yɛaŋ thethe mɛdzogu mɔna i mɛgheksuaŋ nɛ poksɛ'llɛ kɔ
S.TRANSL: the situation [in the eyes of the neighbors] was that some people had come down from somewhere for some reason and had done all these things and had tied a man up —

S.FORM: "ləu! theaŋ i mɛgheksu" pha "khannɛn phɛllɛ ni?"
S.TRANSL: "Hey, why did you tie that man up?"

S.FORM: "napmi himdaŋma ɛtmu taːru khunɛ."
S.TRANSL: "He brought someone else's wife here!"

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛllɛ kudɛmsɛ mɛd'yɛaŋ i mɛgheksuaŋ nɛ pha.
S.TRANSL: They had come to catch him and they had him tied up.

S.FORM: yammu khunɛ kusuba'llɛ khɛpsu.
S.TRANSL: Then his village headman heard,

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ kusubannaŋ t'yɛ.
S.TRANSL: and the headman arrived.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɔ kusuban t'yɛ —
S.TRANSL: The headman arrived

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ kumbhu kun'saˀ jəmmə mɛdzupsɛ mɛd'yɛ.
S.TRANSL: the brothers (of the husband) all came in a group.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ "the poksɛ'llɛ ni ɛmbhɔ jəmmə kɛdzupsi kɛdɛi phɛllɛ ni?"
S.TRANSL: "Why have you all gotten together and come here?"

S.FORM: "ɛmbhɔ iŋga ahimdaŋma ɛllɛ khuːttuaŋ taːru. khuːttu phɛttu." khɔmbhɛllɛ
S.TRANSL: "This man stole my wife and brought her here. He stole her and brought her here.

S.FORM: "iŋga khɔllɛ kuhɔŋsɛ t'yaŋŋɛllɛ ɛtmu ɛllɛ kɔttu rətchə. khɔmbhɛaŋ anigɛ tɛmsumbɛaŋ kheksumbɛaŋ nɛ.
S.TRANSL: I came looking for her and he's got her. So we caught him and we've got him tied up.

S.FORM: alla suba'llɛ kɛdɔŋsubai?
S.TRANSL: Now, headman, are you going to make a deal?

S.FORM: anigɛ ɛn — alla ɛn tɛmsumbɛaŋ teˀrumbɛbai?" phɛllɛ ni
S.TRANSL: Or do we take him away?"

S.FORM: "iŋga tɔŋsuŋ.
S.TRANSL: "I'll settle it.

S.FORM: khɛni jəti khɛni kɛbaːttumb'ɛllɛ bəmojim phɛllɛ mɛnuˀnɛn.
S.TRANSL: But it won't just be whatever amount you say.

S.FORM: ɛllɛ heˀrubasəmm'ɛl lɔt nuˀ.
S.TRANSL: Only what he can afford.

S.FORM: thɔrubasəmm'ɛl lɔt iŋga tɔŋsuŋ piniŋ.
S.TRANSL: I'll only fix you up with as much as he can afford.

S.FORM: tərə ɛllɛ the khambekaŋ yɔllik mɛnɛnɛn.
S.TRANSL: He doesn't have much land.

S.FORM: siŋŋaŋ yɔllik mɛgɔttun. luŋŋaŋ yɔllik mɛgɔttun khɔmbhɛllɛ.
S.TRANSL: He doesn't have much forest or anything.

S.FORM: alla kughambekkɛllɛ akkh'yarik thɔru?
S.TRANSL: Now how much can his land bear?

S.FORM: kukhambekkɛllɛ kudhɔndhɔn lɔt iŋga tɔŋsuŋ piniŋ."
S.TRANSL: I'll fix you up with what his land can bear and no more."

S.FORM: mɛttusiaŋ kusuba'llɛ mɛttusi'llɛ kɔ, "ləu!
S.TRANSL: When the headman said this, they said "Well,

S.FORM: khɔmbhɔ ain anigɛ yaːktigɛba poksɛ."
S.TRANSL: in that case today we'll have to stay over."

S.FORM: yaːktinnɛ!" mɛttusi kusuba'llɛ yammu.
S.TRANSL: "Stay over!" said the headman.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ mɛyaːktɛ.
S.TRANSL: And they stayed.

S.FORM: hɔmbhɛaŋ mɛyuŋɛaŋ kɔ hɔmbhɛaŋ kusuba'llɛ tɔŋsu purusi.
S.TRANSL: Then they stayed and the headman fixed things up for them.

S.FORM: tɔŋsu purusi kɔrɔ yammu niyaːn sumyaːn tərika mɛhɔksu.
S.TRANSL: They looked for a solution for two or three days.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ kɔ kɛsemb'ɛn mɛhɔksu mɛhɔksu mɛhɔksu
S.TRANSL: They tried to find money.

S.FORM: niyaːn sumyaːllɛ mɛghosuaŋ khunchi
S.TRANSL: After two or three days they got some.

S.FORM: "ləu! jəmmərɛ khɛni saʈhi yaŋ lɔt kɛghosumba mɛːnni?
S.TRANSL: "OK! Altogether it's sixty rupees you get, right?

S.FORM: khɔnnaŋ yo khɔnnaŋ tho mɛːn" phɛ poksɛ'llɛ ni alla saʈhi yaŋ khɔmbhɛllɛ
S.TRANSL: No less and no more." — that was the arrangement.

S.FORM: "saʈhi yaŋ ni kɛhɔksum phɔgɔrɔ allo saʈhi yaŋ allo hop.
S.TRANSL: "If you're looking for sixty rupees cash, we don't have sixty rupees now.

S.FORM: ã sumboŋ the piasigɛ.
S.TRANSL: We'll give you thirty rupees,

S.FORM: khɔmbhɔ sumboŋ khɛni the'llɛŋ kɔ khɛnɛ —
S.TRANSL: and then thirty rupees worth of something —

S.FORM: khɛni pit kɛdeˀrumlɔ poŋ saːŋwa kɛdeˀrumlɔ poŋ,"
S.TRANSL: you'll have to take cows, you'll have to take buffaloes."

S.FORM: phɛaŋ kɔ pitɛllɛ kudamaŋ mɛdzogu.
S.TRANSL: So they made a price for cows.

S.FORM: pitɛllɛ kudam pəndrə, saːŋwa'llɛ kudam calis mɛdzoguaŋ kɔ mɛdɔŋsu,
S.TRANSL: They agreed on fifteen rupees as the price of a cow and forty the price of a buffalo.

S.FORM: jəmmə mɛyoˀruaŋ mɛdɔŋsuaŋ. mɛyuŋɛ.
S.TRANSL: They added it all up reached an agreement.

S.FORM: mɛdɔŋsu'llɛ ni khɔmbhɛaŋ mɛsaptu "ləu! saʈhi yaŋŋɛtmu khɛnɛ kɛdɛndɛi?" phɛllɛ
S.TRANSL: When they had agreed, they wrote it down. "OK! Do you agree to sixty rupees."

S.FORM: "tɛndaŋ," lɔˀrɛ keʈa'llɛ kɔ.
S.TRANSL: "I accept," said the boy.

S.FORM: tɛndɛaŋ kɔ saʈhi yaŋŋɛtmu mɛsaptuaŋ sapla mɛsaptuaŋ khunchi jəmmərɛ mɛdɔŋsuaŋ bhərpai mɛsaptu.
S.TRANSL: When they'd agreed on sixty rupees they wrote it down and wrote out the receipt.

S.FORM: mɛsaptuaŋ mɛburu.
S.TRANSL: They wrote it out for him.

S.FORM: mɛburu khɔmbhɛaŋ hatmu kɔ kusubahaˀrɛ jəmmə karbari jəmmə mɛbhuŋsiŋŋaŋ mɛyuŋɛ. aphno dajubhai kumbhu kun'saˀ mɛyuŋɛb'ɛtmu,
S.TRANSL: Then the headman and his assistants all got together. All the parties gathered.

S.FORM: "ləu! alla kɛtɔŋɛ kɔrɔ khɛni yɔllik mɛːndu alla
S.TRANSL: "Well, now if it's agreed, there's not much left to do.

S.FORM: kɛghuːpp'ɛllɛ khɛnɛ kubh'rɛk kɛlɔːtturɔ poŋ.
S.TRANSL: You, the wife-stealer, you have to pay half [of the arbitration fee].

S.FORM: ã kumet kɛbekp'ɛllɛaŋ kubh'rɛk kɛlɔːtturɔ poŋ kumet," mɛmɛttuaŋ kɔ kubh'rɛk kubh'rɛk.
S.TRANSL: And you, whose wife took off, you have to pay half," they said, fifty-fifty.

S.FORM: khɔmbhɛaŋ "yaŋ ŋaŋasi khɛnchi kɛdhasi yaŋ ŋaŋasinu.
S.TRANSL: "You owe five rupees each, and along with the five rupees each,

S.FORM: khɛnchi ləu! thi pɔŋ thik thi pɔŋ thikthik kɛdhasi" mɛmɛttusiaŋ kɔ
S.TRANSL: you owe one pot of whiskey each," they told them.

S.FORM: mɛmɛttusi mɛdɛmsusi'llɛ nɛpmujənalɛ thi pɔŋ thikthiknu yaŋ ŋaŋasi nɛssusi.
S.TRANSL: They caught the two of them, and they put down five rupees and one pot of whiskey each.

S.FORM: nɛssusiaŋ mɛdɔŋsu. ??
S.TRANSL: They put down what they owed and settled the matter.

S.FORM: khanhaˀ ?? ?? mɛyuŋɛaŋ kɔ kudaːndiks'ma kɔ bihandik khunchi mɛsɛrɛaŋ kɔ jəmmə mɛbe.
S.TRANSL: They sat together, and then the next day in the morning they separated and all went off.

S.FORM: ləu tyəti. tyətinəi sər əbə.
S.TRANSL: That's it. That's all, sir, for now.
